burlap.mdp.singleagent.model

Interface RewardFunction

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    DifferentiableRF
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CartPoleDomain.CartPoleRewardFunction, DiffVFRF, FrostbiteRF, GoalBasedRF, GraphRF, GridWorldRewardFunction, InvertedPendulum.InvertedPendulumRewardFunction, LinearDiffRFVInit, LinearStateActionDifferentiableRF, LinearStateDifferentiableRF, LunarLanderRF, NullRewardFunction, PotentialShapedRF, ShapedRewardFunction, SingleGoalPFRF, UniformCostRF

    public interface RewardFunction
    Defines the reward function for a task.
    Author:
    James MacGlashan

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double reward(State s, Action a, State sprime)
      Returns the reward received when action a is executed in state s and the agent transitions to state sprime.

    • Method Detail

      • reward

        double reward(State s,
              Action a,
              State sprime)
        Returns the reward received when action a is executed in state s and the agent transitions to state sprime.
        Parameters:
        s - the state in which the action was executed
        a - the action executed
        sprime - the state to which the agent transitioned
        Returns:
        the reward received when action a is executed in state s and the agent transitions to state sprime.
